alert.note: Alert for Blaine; Brown; Eastern Cherry; Keya Paha; Rock (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Blizzard Warning issued December 24 at 11:55PM CST until December 27 at 6:00AM CST by NWS NorthPlatte
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY WILL EXPIRE AT MIDNIGHT CST TONIGHT... ...BLIZZARD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 AM CST WEDNESDAY... * WHAT...Blizzard conditions expected with total snow accumulations of 9 to 18 inches. The highest amounts will generally occur near and east of Highway 183. Winds gusting as high as 55 mph. * WHERE...Eastern Cherry, Keya Paha, Brown, Rock and Blaine Counties. * WHEN...For the Winter Weather Advisory, until midnight CST tonight. For the Blizzard Warning, from midnight tonight to 6 AM CST Wednesday. * IMPACTS...Travel will be dangerous to nearly impossible. Blowing snow will significantly reduce visibility, including whiteout conditions at times. Strong winds could cause tree damage.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. Travel should be restricted to emergencies only. If you must travel, have a winter survival kit with you. If you get stranded, stay with your vehicle. Call Nebraska 511 for the latest road information. A Blizzard Warning means severe winter weather conditions are expected or occurring. Falling and blowing snow with strong winds and poor visibilities are likely. This will lead to whiteout conditions, making travel extremely dangerous. Do not travel. If you must travel, have a winter survival kit with you. If you get stranded, stay with your vehicle.

area.areaDesc: Blaine; Brown; Eastern Cherry; Keya Paha; Rock
